Just realized BREAKING BAD starts NEXT Sunday. Wandering the streets in a tattered bathrobe, openly sobbing & peeing everywhere.

— Patrick Walsh (@thepatrickwalsh) July 8, 2012

I got to the airport two hours early to watch the Wimbledon final because I'm a model white person.

— Jamie Rosengard (@jamieeros) July 8, 2012

It's when I'm shouting at sport on the telly that I feel I am truly my father's daughter.

— Faye Woods (@FayebellineW) July 8, 2012

Federer will have to challenge every single call, because all of the line judges are British. #Wimbledon

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) July 8, 2012

To help, some of the ball boys have urinated on the towels they pass to Federer. #Wimbledon

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) July 8, 2012

Huge amount of pressure that guy must be under this afternoon. All that expectation. Still, pretty confident Columbo will solve the case.

— Tony (@cockbongo) July 8, 2012

Roger Federer is today being played by one of the Prometheus Engineers wearing some foundation and a wig. #Wimbledon

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) July 8, 2012

Whatever, Andy Murray. Paul Bettany already did this in 2004. #Wimbledon

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) July 8, 2012

Every time Murray makes a mistake it's because he had an idea for a funny tweet mid-swing & got distracted. #wimbledon

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) July 8, 2012

No-one would notice any difference if Boris Becker was replaced in the commentary box by a sandwich. #Wimbledon

— Paul Whitelaw (@paulwhitelaw) July 8, 2012

Shit bollocks sod it. #wimbledon

— Elizabeth Windsor (@Queen_UK) July 8, 2012

Andy's making me cry! #Wimbledon

Stop making me cry, Andy Murray! #Wimbledon

Oh, Andy. **cries**

::crying:: with Andy.

.@andy_murray made me cry

Oh Andy / You came and you lost without flailing / And you made us verklempt / Oh Andy. #Wimbledon

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) July 8, 2012

Little-known #Wimbledon fact: the loser has to cut the grass next year.

Mixed doubles would be much more interesting if at least one of the players was some sort of shark-arachnid hybrid. #Wimbledon

— Paul Whitelaw (@paulwhitelaw) July 8, 2012

Roger Federer is an incredible tennis player. But does anybody else see Quentin Tarantino holding a tennis racquet? Just me then.

— Cameron Yarde Jnr (@CameronYardeJnr) July 8, 2012

Netflix has an amazing business model. People basically pay them to say, "Uch, there's nothing good on Netflix."

And why do we eat at Toast? WHY? Well, because The Hills filmed here and so did Entourage and US Weekly writes about it. I think that's why.

— Agent Trainee (@AgentTrainee) July 8, 2012

Probably enough time has passed by now for a Battleship reboot.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) July 8, 2012

Just recast Taylor Kitsch with Channing Tatum. RT @MarkHarrisNYC: Probably enough time has passed by now for a Battleship reboot.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 8, 2012

It occurred to me today at my Second City class that if I use every bathrom stall at some point, Tina Fey and I will have shared a toilet.

— FLAMES ON (@thesideofmyface) July 8, 2012

Now homophobes and every actor on The CW will have something in common: Bing as their default search engine. http://t.co/IPRUTFHg

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) July 8, 2012

Don Draper playing softball will be best thing to happen to Monday @GoodTVeets since Smash. MT @MLB: Jon Hammâ€™s jersey pic.twitter.com/ltqdtTYL

Spoiler- my tweets will be about @chrissyteigen MT @jlschaefer: [Hamm] playing softball will be best thing for Mon. @GoodTVeets since Smash.

"By clicking 'Tweet,' you consent to having your tweet repurposed in a useless article titled 'Twitter Reacts to Ernest Borgnine's Death.'"

— Louis Peitzman (@LouisPeitzman) July 8, 2012

McHale and Sheriff Taylor lost in the same week. Hug your television. :(

— Rob Sheridan (@robertdsheridan) July 8, 2012

Dear HBO: Please create a show called LADIES, featuring Asha Greyjoy, Brienne of Tarth, Arya Stark, and Arienne Martell living in Brooklyn.

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) July 8, 2012

Well, I _was_ just going to watch one episode of Slings & Arrows, but it turns out it's basically impossible to do that.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) July 9, 2012

The secret ingredient in Gordon Ramsay's cooking is hate.

— Jenny Johnson (@JennyJohnsonHi5) July 9, 2012

Is there anything better than Judy Greer screaming "you're not my supervisor"? I am not sure there is.

— Ken! The Herald Angels Sing (@kenlowery) July 9, 2012

Psyched for Dateline/48hrs/48hrsmystery tonight. It's that one where it turns out that the husband murdered his wife.

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) July 9, 2012

Now that I'm obsessed w/HGTV, I often say things like, "This house has good bones."

— Lindsay Palmer (@lnpalmer2000) July 9, 2012

This weekend I watched eight hours of "Extreme Makeover: Weight Loss Edition." I am the only person on Twitter who can say this.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) July 9, 2012

"Waterworld 2 is dead if Tripplehorn can't do it" Kevin Costner loudly said to no one at his back table at Veggie Grill.

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) July 9, 2012

I'm OK with #TrueBlood being WTF crazy. But it's the boring that's driving me nuts.

— Teri Vogel (@tmvogel) July 9, 2012

Somehow this season of True Blood has made Tara likeable and Sookie a badass. It's not a perfect show but this is pretty awesome.

— Emma Fraser (@frazbelina) July 9, 2012

Yelling is not acting. Can you guess what I'm watching?

— Danielle Turchiano (@danielletbd) July 9, 2012

"The news-" "Yes?" "The news is about who we were. I want to talk about who we _are_." "So, the... nows?" #possiblenewsroomdialogue

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) July 9, 2012

"Walk with me." #possiblenewsroomdialogue

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) July 9, 2012

Can we all agree that the worst part of #TheNewsroom is the nostalgic credit sequence with the inspirational string music?

— Meredith Blake (@MeredithBlake) July 9, 2012

Bitching about people bitching about people bitching about The Newsroom is the new bitching about people bitching about The Newsroom.

— Stephen Smith (@smithsj) July 9, 2012

Idea for a movie: A car accident causes Aaron Sorkin to get stuck in a small town for a week, where he slowly learns to respect them.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 9, 2012

The best thing about "The Newsroom" is that "Breaking Bad" starts next week.

— ðŸŽ„Chris WilsonðŸŽ„ (@realchriswilson) July 9, 2012

Why can't the women on this show hold their shit together? #TheNewsroom

— James Wolcott (@JamesWolcott) July 9, 2012

How's everyone enjoying David Frum's #TheNewsroom tonight?

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) July 9, 2012

""The Newsroom" is important television, the closest we've had to "must-see TV" in recent years." -- Dan Rather, TV critic

— Person of Mattress (@digifreak642) July 9, 2012

Lulz, Rather. Pick up your remote more often.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 9, 2012

@TVandDinners: He watches HDNet exclusively. This is a big step for him, watching HBO.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 9, 2012

Newsroom isn't just tedious, it's factually inaccurate. Sorkin needs a remedial class in broadcast history. "It's news 101!"

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 9, 2012

Is it possible that #Newsroom is trying to tell us all something? I can never tell, the subtext is so delicate.

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 9, 2012

If every episode of The Newsroom has Sam Waterston basically begging to fight someone, I will be mildly happy. We're 3 for 3 so far.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 9, 2012

What I've learned from tonight's episode of The Newsroom: Aaron Sorkin's all-time guilty-pleasure movie is Rocky II.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 9, 2012

"Who am I? I'm Jack Newsroom and I BUILT this company, dammit!" - scene from Newsroom

— John Moe (@johnmoe) July 9, 2012

In the last 7 days we've seen one of the best and one of the worst examples of middlebrow catnip in TV history. #louie #newsroom

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 9, 2012

I need to watch something to get the Newsroom out of my mindgrapes. What is the antidote for Sorkin? Xavier Renegade Angel? Brule? Tim&Eric?

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 9, 2012

I am trying to watch #Newsroom without snarking. I think it is physically impossible.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 9, 2012

Women on #Newsroom A) work for Will McAvoy & are crazy B) Drink pink drinks in midtown or C) can be neurosurgeons, if the joke calls for it

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) July 9, 2012

Can we get a show of Jane Fonda & Sam Waterston arguing in Sorkin-ian dialogue for an hour each week? Cause I would watch that. #TheNewsroom

— Tim (@rural_juror) July 9, 2012

The gals take it on the chin again in #TheNewsroom. Panic attacks! Next Allison Pill's uterus comes out at night and shoplifts at Bergdorfs.

— Wil Zmak (@wilzmak) July 9, 2012

At least this week's Newsroom was structurally interesting; it was also a complete and total mess, but in new and exciting ways!

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) July 9, 2012

One last Newsroom nitpick before I go to sleep: pretty sure the reference to Scott Walker wanting to bust unions was fairly anachronistic.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) July 9, 2012

@Memles You say anachronistic, I say foreshadowing in proper serialized fashion.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) July 9, 2012

Sorkin has ruined television for the rest of us. RT @RowanKaiser You say anachronistic, I say foreshadowing in proper serialized fashion.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) July 9, 2012

Just watched Sam Waterston say "douchebaggery 101." Awesome. #Newsroom

— Lesley Goldberg (@Snoodit) July 9, 2012

Has anybody talked about the Charlie Crist mistake on #Newsroom? Cuz as much as I enjoyed the episode, that's a bad mistake.

tweets.author_name: Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There
tweets.html:
NEWSROOM is about journalists who travel 2 the future then use this knowledge 2 make folks in the past feel stupid 4 not knowing the future.

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) July 9, 2012

Satire is a plunger that gets blamed for all the shit it pulls up.

— God (@TheTweetOfGod) July 9, 2012

The greatest trick the devil ever pulled was convincing the world they'd see something cool in the "Unrated Version."

— Jason Mustian (@jasonmustian) July 9, 2012
